intro: Uvaria lastoursvillensis, commonly known as the lastoursvillensis uvaria, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Madagascar. It is a small evergreen shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically dark red when mature. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
